Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Immune \Im*mune"\, a. [L. immunis. See {Immunity}.] 1. Exempt; protected. -- {Im*mu"nize}, v. t. [1913 Webster]
2. (Med.) Protected from disease due to the action of the immune system, especially by having been inoculated against or previously exposed to a disease. [PJC]
3. (Med.) Of or pertaining to the immune system or the components of the immune system. [PJC]
4. Not responsive; as, immune to suggestion. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Immune \Im*mune"\, n. One who is immune; esp., a person who is immune from a disease by reason of previous affection with the disease or inoculation. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

immune adj 1: relating to the condition of immunity; "the immune system" 2: secure against; "immune from taxation as long as he resided in Bermuda"; "immune from criminal prosecution" 3: relating to or conferring immunity (to disease or infection) [syn: {resistant}] 4: (usually followed by `to') not affected by a given influence; "immune to persuasion" n : a person who is immune to a particular infection
